document.title: Configuration Functions
document.synopsis: Functions for reading configuration options -- mostly used internally.

function.name: load
function.synopsis: Loads configuration options from the database
function.note: Modules should rarely need to call this function, Oyster automatically takes care of loading module configuration data.

If a table name and hashref are absent, they are automatically assumed from the caller. If "foo" called "config::load()", the table would default to site_db_prefix_foo_config and the configuration data would be stored in %foo::config
function.prototype: config::load([table => string config_table_name][, config_hash => hashref config_hash]);
